column4: Sample code for reader showing scale, crop and mean image augmentation for CNTK on GitHub
Tutorial showing how to transform images into CNTK format using CIFAR 10 dataset as an example
Helpful display of types and examples (in pics) of image augmentation from Python package
Tutorial on image reading like found at the beginning of this CNTK tutorial

Understanding representation in training and test data in "A few grains of salt" section under (**need to make more prominent**) around having representative datasets especially if using a catch-all class label.
CNTK is sensitive to image dimensions (width/height) so images are often scaled or padded to have same width and height
An explanation of neural network hyperparameters
Discussion and addressing network misclassification due to image quality/resolution/blur etc.
Explanations of readers, deserializers and transforms for CNTK
Sample code for reader showing scale image augmentation for CNTK on GitHub
Image augmentation with keras
A machine learning algorithm cheat sheet like the one that exists for traditional ML but for deep learning
Clear guidance on when/who should be using tool or service. eg should I use Batch AI or Shipyard for my ML training workload?
The docs needed to accomplish some of these tasks are spread across platforms like GitHub doc.microsoft some on azure and random readthedocs sites. It is a disjointed experience
TensorFlow external doc: A simple example of image classification using Cifar 10 data set
TensorFlow external doc: classifying Cifar 10 data
TensorFlow external doc: Tutorial for classification using Transfer Learning
TensorFlow external doc: tutorial/lab going over concepts relevant for image classification
TensorFlow external doc: image classification examples using MNIST. Contains multiple code samples demonstrating different approaches
Azure ML Workbench has tutorials for both TensorFlow and CNTK for classification with MNIST data
End-to-end tutorial on MNIST dataset using CNTK for image reading, layer definition, training and testing with nice comparisons to tensorflow

How to improve a classifier(with better data) using Custom Vision Service (a few nugets of critical knowledge applicable to image analysis with ML in general) "Include images that are representative of what your classifier will encounter in the real world" with good and bad examples
Example code using CiFar 10 dataset and implementing ResNet paper
Image Classification with CNTK and transfer learning. A lot like TensorFlow for poets
Image Classification tutorial using CNTK. Includes topics such as dropout and batchnormalization
Azure ML Workbench links to this tutorial that goes through image classification with training and deployment
The Azure ML image classification tutorial is based on this project. Tutorial uses CNTK but this repo includes a TensorFlow version
TensorFlow external doc: Tutorial for Object Detection API. Can swap between models
TensorFlow external doc: Quickstart for object detection. Includes instructions for training on Google Cloud
TensorFlow external doc: Tutorial for object detection using the latest API
A tutorial on VoTT tool. Instructions exist but not a tutorial
Explaination on how to use the VoTT tool for image tagging
Tutorial for object detection using Fast R-CNN
Documentation for Faster R-CNN using CNTK. Includes instructions and examples
Inclusion in tutorial on adjusting model hyperparameters for object detection with CNTK - what do all of these hyperparams mean?
Code story for detecting birds using CNTK with Azure ML Workbench
Install CNTK Option 1:  Install CNTK locally for Windows or Ubuntu Linux (GPU Options)
Install CNTK Option 2:  Leverage the DSVM for CNTK as it comes preinstalled (GPU Options)
Install CNTK Option 3:  Install CNTK within a Docker Container (GPU Option and obscured CPU Option **update please**)
Install CNTK Option 4:  Leverage Azure Notebooks as it comes pre-installed (CPU only)
Documentation for almost all ML training options are on Azure/Microsoft but Shipyard is on a separate readthedocs site
Training and serving CNTK using Kubernetes on Azure
The best documentation for training TensorFlow models on Azure using Kubernetes is outside of docs. It is linked to from the blog post on training CNTK
Batch AI Documentation which includes coverage for CNTK and TensorFlow
Batch AI template for working with TensorFlow or Distributed TensorFlow
Batch AI templates for working with CNTK with Python or Brainscript. Also includes Distributed option
A blog post walking through deploying a trained model using webapps. Not in docs and similar content does not exist for TensorFlow
Code and tutorial on deploying a CNTK model using ACS with DC/OS. No equivalent for TensorFlow
Azure ML Workbench Model management setup a getting started guide to deploying a model to azure using Docker and Kubernetes. Works for CNTK and TensorFlow
AML Workbench tutorial for deploying a deep learning model. Covers CNTK and TensorFlow
Really nice example with a more comprehensive Python code sample on deployment and consumption of a CNTK service for dealing with images (**need better findability**)
Operationalization in CNTK docs (**in AML docs, but not CNTK**)
Consume an image web service with the nice AML CLI
Set up for and consume image service. Includes C# and Python samples
Image data serialization for a web service
Image data compression for a web service
Stanford Course on Computer Vision Tasks
Learning TensorFlow by Itay Lieder Yehezkel S. Resheff and Tom Hope is a high level step by step instructions on getting started in TensorFlow
Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn and TensorFlow by Aurelien Geron takes you deeper in your understanding of how TensorFlow and Deep learning work
